Event.name: Duplication
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame involves a <fen>Creator</fen> making a duplicate, the <fen>Copy</fen>, of some <fen>Original</fen> entity. A <fen>Source</fen>, the location of the <fen>Original</fen>, and <fen>Goal</fen>, the location of the <fen>Copy</fen>, may be expressed.
<ex><fex name="Creator">The teacher</fex> <t>copied</t> <fex name="Original">the problem</fex> <fex name="Goal">onto the blackboard</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Copy">His handouts</fex> were <fex name="Manner">poorly</fex> <t>photocopied</t> <fex name="Creator"> by his assistant</fex><fex name="Original">from my originals </fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Creator
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Copy</fen> based on the <fen>Original</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument. <ex><fex name="Creat">Pat</fex> <t>photocopied</t> the article.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Original
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Original</fen> is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object:<ex>Pat <t>photocopied</t> <fex name="Orig">the article</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Copy
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Copy</fen> produced by the <fen>Creator</fen> is frequently not expressed. However, when <fen>Copy</fen> does occur, it is usually expressed as the External Argument of verbs: <ex><fex name="Copy">The results</fex> <t>replicate</t> those of an earlier study.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the location from which material is copied, i.e. the location of the <fen>Original</fen>. Unlike the FE <fen>Source</fen> in other domains and frames, there is no actual movement of either <fen>Copy</fen> or <fen>Original</fen> from this location. <fen>Source</fen> is usually expressed by a PP Complement.
<ex>I <t>copied</t> the design <fex name="Src">from a magazine</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location to which material is copied. Unlike the FE <fen>Goal</fen> in other frames, there is no actual movement of any entity to this location. <fen>Goal</fen> is usually expressed as a PP Complement: <ex><t>Copy</t> the file <fex name="Goal">onto the hard drive</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Characterization
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE designates the character of the medium in which a <fen>Copy</fen> is made. Usually, it is expressed as PP-in or AP. <ex>They sold a million <t>copies</t> <fex name="Char">in hardback</fex>.</ex> <ex>Opposite is Pilinsky's <fex name="Char">wood-engraved</fex> <t>copy</t>.</ex> <ex>The margins are covered in <t>copies</t> of the works of Shelley <fex name="Char">in Joan's handwriting</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Creator</fen> that lets them bring about the duplication. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Manner</fen> of performing an action</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>Result of an event</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase that describes a primary participant, either the <fen>Creator</fen> or the <fen>Copy</fen>/ <fen>Original</fen>. <ex>Such leaflets have to be <t>duplicated</t> <fex name="Depict">en masse</fex>.</ex> <ex>She did the <t>copying</t> <fex name="Depict">unaware of the fact that John had already finished it</fex>.</ex></def-root >

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Degree</fen> to which event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>Where the event takes <fen>Place</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Instrument</fen> with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Fidelity
Arg.definition: <def-root>The way in which the <fen>Copy</fen> matches or does not match the <fen>Original</fen>. <ex>I made a <fex name="Fid">half-size</fex> <t>copy</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Iterations</fen> is the number of times the <fen>Original</fen> is copied. <ex><fex name="Creator">Jim</fex> <t>copied</t> <fex name="Original">the book</fex> <fex name="Iterations">300 times</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Frequency</fen> is the frequency with which the <fen>Original</fen> is copied. <ex><fex name="Creator">The scribes</fex> <t>copied</t> <fex name="Original">the scripture</fex> <fex name="Frequency">every 80 years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity that participates in much the same way as another participant (<fen>Creator</fen>, <fen>Copy</fen>, or <fen>Original</fen>), although it is characterized as being less focal to the action.
<ex><t>Copy</t> my list <fex name="Co-participant">along with yours</fex> .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: clone.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing regarded as identical with another; a copy or double.

lexUnit.name: copy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing made to be similar or identical to another.

lexUnit.name: duplicate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: one of two or more identical things.

lexUnit.name: duplicate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or be an exact copy of.

lexUnit.name: photocopy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a photographic copy of something produced by a process involving the action of light on a specially prepared surface.

lexUnit.name: reduplicate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: repeat or copy so as to form another of the same kind.

lexUnit.name: replicate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an exact copy of; reproduce.

lexUnit.name: reproduce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: produce a copy or representation of.

lexUnit.name: replica.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an exact copy or model of something, especially one on a smaller scale.

lexUnit.name: duplication.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the fact of making an exact copy

lexUnit.name: run off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: produce a copy on a machine.

lexUnit.name: clone.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to produce an effectively indistinguishible copy of.
